definitions.definition: behave toward or deal with in a certain way.
synonyms: handle; literaryuse "Charlotte treated him very badly"

definitions.definition: regard something as being of a specified nature with implications for one's actions concerning it.
examples: the names are being treated as classified information
synonyms: think of "police are treating the fires as arson"

definitions.definition: give medical care or attention to; try to heal or cure.
examples: the two were treated for cuts and bruises
synonyms: administer (to); Moremedicate "she was treated at St. Paul's Hospital"cure
combat "the plants may prove useful in treating cancer"

definitions.definition: apply a process or a substance to (something) to protect or preserve it or to give it particular properties.
examples: linen creases badly unless it is treated with the appropriate finish
the lectures show a striking variation in the level at which subjects are treated
synonyms: analyze "the book treats its subject with insight and responsibility"

definitions.definition: provide someone with (food, drink, or entertainment) at one's own expense.
examples: the old man had treated him to a drink or two
synonyms: give (to) someone; Morepay for (for someone); foot the bill for
pick up the tab for "she treated him to an expensive meal"regale with
divert with "delegates were treated to an Indonesian dance show"

examples: he treated her to one of his smiles

definitions.definition: do or have something that gives one great pleasure.
negotiate terms with someone, especially an opponent.
examples: propagandists claimed that he was treating with the enemy

definitions.definition: an event or item that is out of the ordinary and gives great pleasure.
examples: he wanted to take her to the movies as a treat
synonyms: guilty pleasure; informalgoodie "I bought you some chocolate as a treat"pleasure
joy "it was a real treat to see them"

definitions.definition: used with a possessive adjective to indicate that the person specified is paying for food, entertainment, etc., for someone else.
examples: noun: one's treat; plural noun: one's treats
